ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were playing with their hands and feet while walking in inhabited areas. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.3.1_0: “‘I will walk well-restrained in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.4_0: he should walk well-restrained in inhabited areas;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, plays with his hands and feet while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.12_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk5:1.13_0: The fifth training rule is finished.
